p.s: The articelarticle Hope of escape lost in translation, written by Zia Haider Rahman, published on The Sunday Times 17th December 2016, is about the own history of the author and the problems people have, when they arrive in Great Britain and have to learn or speak English.
The author writewrites about the financial cost for translating and interpreting for people, who do not speak English.
He also writewrites about the bad sides of London, where people take for example drugs.
Zia Haider Rahman tells his own story and how he arrived in GBGreat Britain and learn with his family English.
Furthermore he tells about the huge problems people have in for example school, when they are not from English and have to learn a new language.
In the last part of this articelarticle, the author writes about the different ways to help immigrants.
